intro: Campynema lineare, commonly known as the slender campynema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. Campynema lineare is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
